topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b37e9a636872731def0600#post_53b37e9a636872731def0600
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b37e13636872731db70600#post_53b37e13636872731db70600
At the risk of sounding callous, hopefully it stays there and doesn't spread further[/bq]
Yeah; as much as it sounds callous I think we can all agree on this.  That's pretty much what the plan is anyhow.

The doctors straight up know it's going to kill a fuck ton of people; their plan at this point is to keep it from spreading further.  They sure as hell don't want it to spread beyond the Sahara.
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b37e976368727084410700#post_53b37e976368727084410700
[bq="Randomosaur"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b37e13636872731db70600#post_53b37e13636872731db70600
What if it crosses over to Asia?[/bq]
Hundreds of millions of deaths.  Right now if it crosses the Sahara then that's pretty much if for Africa and potentially the middle east.  Let's just hope it doesn't cross into Asia cause hypothetically speaking mainland China would not be able to handle such a event.  Worse if it gets into say India.


It's probably not going to come to the Americas, Europe, Australia, Japan or such but still it could be a big fucking problem.


Tl:dr; If it crosses the Sahara GG Africa and middle east.

topics.body:
"@Ore-O":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b3801a63687274aab80600#post_53b3801a63687274aab80600
[bq="Ore-O"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b37e996368726d4b0b0000#post_53b37e996368726d4b0b0000
Welp, should we start worrying?[/bq]
The cdc and most countries are already watching this to prevent it from spreading.

Don't worry yet cause most first world countries will be able to handle such a outbreak and most doctors are trained in how to handle a outbreak.  The problem is second or third world countries in Africa or the Middle East.

I say just keep a eye on it for now.  Hypothetically at worst it'll be game over Africa and Middle East.  I doubt it'll spread beyond that. . . hopefully.

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b380a1636872791d7a0000#post_53b380a1636872791d7a0000
[bq="Randomosaur"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b37fb763687206b1b30500#post_53b37fb763687206b1b30500
Europe isn't that far from the Middle East.[/bq]
Yeah, I know; European countries are for the most part are either first or second world countries and will be able to handle potential outbreaks.

If it spreads to Europe we're only talking about a couple ten thousand dead; if it spreads to the rest of Africa and the Middle East we're looking at a massive chunk of everyone there dead.  I'm not talking a moderate outbreak; I'm talking just straight up anyone breaking the quarantine line gets shot level outbreak in Africa and the Middle East.

The reason why the current outbreak is only killin 65% of infected is because of how serious face'd the doctors are at stopping it and the currently infected countries while they're not well off still can put up a fight.  Countries like Zimbabwe though. . . They're going to get fucked hard.  Ebola has on average a 96% death rate; imagine 96% of Zimbabwe gone.
